content: this legal case involves two parties referred to as aa and bb and centers around the termination and partition of joint ownership of property the case has been ongoing for 4 years and 10 months the viru county court initially made a decision which was appealed by both parties the tartu district court later annulled the previous decision and ordered that the obligations arising from loan agreements be considered as joint property obligations the court also ordered compensation to be awarded to bb aas appeal was dismissed while bbs appeal was partially satisfied the court determined the properties involved and the liabilities arising from the loan agreements aa was granted sole ownership of one property while bb was granted sole ownership of the other property bb was also assigned the liabilities arising from the loan agreements the court dismissed bbs request to consider another obligation and ordered mutual financial compensation between the parties the court also determined the costs of the proceedings with aa being ordered to pay bb a certain amount for procedural costs the possibility of appealing the decision to the supreme court is mentioned the court case also involves a dispute over the division of common property with the plaintiff seeking to keep one property and receive compensation or sell it and divide the proceeds equally the defendant disputes the value of the property and argues for the consideration of additional loan obligations the county court partially satisfied both the plaintiffs and defendants claims dividing the joint property and ordering compensation the defendant appealed the decision leading to a new decision by the district court the district court considered the loan obligations and division of assets and liabilities ultimately determining that the plaintiff should remain the sole owner of the property the court also addressed the division of procedural costs the supreme court later granted the plaintiffs cassation appeal leading to a new review by the district court the district court made a final decision offsetting mutual claims and ordering compensation between the parties the court also addressed the distribution of procedural costs ordering the plaintiff to pay a certain amount to the defendant the judgment partially annulled the decision of the state court the text also mentions the return of a witness fee and provides details of a loan agreement between aa and bb
